artifacts.name: Sunglasses
artifacts.description: Ray-Ban style sunglasses. Scratched lenses. Still smell faintly of Axe.
artifacts.milo_lore: These came from BORED's dressing room, back in 1994. A kid left them there one day and never came back. His parents never reported him missing. Everyone just... moved on. The sunglasses sat on a shelf for seven years before someone swept them into a corner.
artifacts.visual_effect: Colors become slightly oversaturated when carrying

artifacts.name: Sticker Sheets
artifacts.description: Holographic rave stickers, neon colors. Circa 1998.
artifacts.milo_lore: These are from an illegal rave, 1998. Summer of '98. Everyone who had a sheet like this—didn't matter if they went to the rave—everyone who *had* these stickers moved away within six months. Same month. All of them. I checked. Mailed inquiry forms to all the old addresses. No forwarding.

artifacts.name: Necronomicon Bookmark
artifacts.description: A leather bookmark, tassel still attached. Worn from use. Held a page in a book with no title.
artifacts.milo_lore: This bookmark came from a book in the anchor store's paperback section. Someone reported the entire book missing—no title recorded, no author recalled. Just... gone. The bookmark was found three months later, fifty feet away, bent in half. Like it had been thrown. I still don't know what book it was.
artifacts.visual_effect: Text on screen becomes occasionally unreadable

artifacts.name: Arcade Token
artifacts.description: Gold token. Stamped with an arcade logo that doesn't exist anymore.
artifacts.milo_lore: This is from an arcade that hasn't been in this mall for twelve years. I've never seen one before. Not one. It's like the arcade was erased. But this token survived. How does a single token from a place that never existed remain?
artifacts.visual_effect: Screen glitches occasionally to simulated arcade graphics

artifacts.name: Leather Wallet
artifacts.description: Brown leather, worn smooth. No ID inside. Only receipts.
artifacts.milo_lore: Found this in the anchor store. No identification. Just receipts from 1996. Different stores, all in this mall. Store names I don't recognize. And the dates are all from March 1996. One month of receipts. Then nothing. No owner was ever found.

artifacts.name: Gift Card (Dead Brand)
artifacts.description: A faded gift card. Store logo worn away. Says '$50 balance' but the store closed in 2003.
artifacts.milo_lore: Fifty dollars. Never redeemed. From a store that died twenty years ago. Could have been worth something. Now it's just plastic memory.

artifacts.name: Film Roll
artifacts.description: 35mm film canister. Labels say 1989. The photos inside are mostly blank or overexposed.
artifacts.milo_lore: Developed in 1989 at the photo shop that used to be here. Thirty-six photos. Nothing on any of them. Like the film was never exposed. Or exposed to something that shouldn't be photographed.
artifacts.visual_effect: Random frames display with blown-out exposure

artifacts.name: Escalator Grease
artifacts.description: A vial of oily residue collected from an escalator step. Rust and synthetic smell.
artifacts.milo_lore: This is from the escalators. Been accumulating since the 80s. Grease from escalator steps collects things—hair, dust, time itself, it seems. I collected this one day. It sits in the shop.
artifacts.visual_effect: Vision becomes smudged/greasy, harder to see clearly

artifacts.name: Keychain
artifacts.description: A silver keychain. The key attached fits nothing. Purpose unknown.
artifacts.milo_lore: A key without a lock. I've tried it everywhere. Store doors, old vending machines, the arcade cabinet—which doesn't exist. It fits nothing in the mall. But someone carried it here. Someone thought it was important.

artifacts.name: Food Court Tray
artifacts.description: A plastic cafeteria tray from the food court. Still has food residue. From 1987.
artifacts.milo_lore: This tray was found under a table in the food court. Date stamped underneath: 1987. The food has fossilized. No one knows how long it's been there. The smell is indescribable.
artifacts.visual_effect: Slight degradation filter applied to visuals

artifacts.name: Phone Charm
artifacts.description: A tiny plush animal hanging from a phone cord. 1990s style.
artifacts.milo_lore: Used to be on someone's Motorola Razr. Or a Nokia brick. Something from the 90s. The cord is still attached. Like it was cut from a phone, not removed.
artifacts.visual_effect: Small visual artifacts appear on screen edges

artifacts.name: Graffiti Marker
artifacts.description: A thick-tipped marker, nearly dry. Color: unknown (worn off).
artifacts.milo_lore: From BORED's shop. He uses these to tag merchandise and posters. This one's run dry. But the tip's chewed up, like it was used to write on something harder than paper. Like it was used on walls.
artifacts.visual_effect: Screen gets occasional drawn lines and marks

artifacts.name: Old Receipt
artifacts.description: A paper receipt, faded and crumpled. Text barely readable.
artifacts.milo_lore: A receipt from a store that closed in 1997. Total amount: $7.43. Item names are illegible. Paid in cash, apparently. No memory of what was purchased.
artifacts.visual_effect: Text fades and becomes hard to read

artifacts.name: Utility Keychain
artifacts.description: Brass keychain used by maintenance staff. Opens nothing consumers would recognize.
artifacts.milo_lore: This belonged to someone in maintenance. Left behind decades ago. I don't know what it opens. Probably utility closets. Probably things no one should see.
artifacts.visual_effect: Vision zooms in and out unpredictably
